Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: WELL TEST TYPE: This reference table identifies the general type of test used toevaluate the potential of the well. For example, Drill Stem Tests (DST), RepeatFormation Tests (RFT), Initial Potential(IP).
Column Comment.3: RUN NUMBER: A number which uniquely identifies the run or trip into the well for thepurpose of operating a test.
Column Comment.4: TEST_NUMBER: A number used to uniquely identify the individual test occurringwithin a test run or trip.
Column Comment.5: REPORT NUMBER: Identifies the specific report containing the computed gaugeanalysis data.
Column Comment.6: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.7: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.8: COMPUTED PERMEABILITY: Value for the measured permeability of the formation(the measure of the ease with which a fluid flows through a rock).
Column Comment.9: COMPUTED PERMEABILITY OUOM: Permeability original unit of measure.
Column Comment.10: CONFIDENCE LIMIT: Final extrapolated confidence limit, in PSIG. Indicates thedegree of confidence associated with extrapolated reservoir pressure.
Column Comment.11: CONFIDENCE LIMIT OUOM: Confidence limit original unit of measure.
Column Comment.12: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.13: ESTIMATED DAMAGE RATIO: Estimated damage ratio. Undamaged permeability ofthe reservoir divided by the permeability measured during a DST. Reflects the skindamage.
Column Comment.14: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.15: EXTRAPOLATION PRESSURE PERCENT = Extrapolation to reservoir pressure as apercentage of Finial Shut In Pressure.
Column Comment.16: FINAL RESERVOIR PRESSURE: The final extrapolated reservoir pressure which iscomputed from the plotted gauge information (Final shutin pressure).
Column Comment.17: FINAL RESERVOIR PRESSURE OUOM: Final reservoir pressure original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.18: GAUGE DEPTH: The measured depth of the pressure recording device a the time ofthe analysis.
Column Comment.19: GAUGE DEPTH OUOM: Gauge depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.20: INVESTIGATION RADIUS: The radius of investigation (the distance from the holethat was investigated by the testing apparatus).
Column Comment.21: INVESTIGATION RADIUS OUOM: Radius of investigation original unit of measure.
Column Comment.22: MAXIMUM RESERVOIR PRESSURE: The extrapolated maximum reservoir pressure(initial shutin pressure) computed from the plotted gauge information.
Column Comment.23: MAXIMUM RESERVOIR PRESSURE OUOM: Maximum reservoir pressure originalunit of measure.
Column Comment.24: POTENTIOMETRIC SURFACE HEIGHT: Measurement for the surface height towhich water from an aquifer will rise in wells in an area.
Column Comment.25: POTENTIOMETRIC SURFACE HEIGHT OUOM: Potentiometric surface original unitof measure.
Column Comment.26: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.27: PRODUCTION INDEX RATE: Production index is the flow rate that a well canproduce per psi difference between the reservoir and bottom hole pressures (staticand flowing).
Column Comment.28: PRODUCTIVITY INDEX RATE OUOM: Productivity index original unit of measure.
Column Comment.29: RECORDER IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier assigned to each recorder.
Column Comment.30: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.31: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.32: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.33: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.34: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.35: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.36: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.37: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
